trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Moxtra | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Moxtra | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Moxtra.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Moxtra.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Moxtra
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Moxtra

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Moxtra with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Moxtra with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: Integrating Moxtra with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: Integrating Moxtra with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Moxtra
trans-unit.target: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Moxtra

trans-unit.source: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Moxtra (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts
trans-unit.target: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Moxtra (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts

trans-unit.source: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal
trans-unit.target: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal

trans-unit.source: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see [What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see [What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD integration with Moxtra, you need the following items:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD integration with Moxtra, you need the following items:

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD subscription

trans-unit.source: A Moxtra single-sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Moxtra single-sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:

trans-unit.source: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.
trans-unit.target: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Scenario Description
trans-unit.target: Scenario Description

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of two main building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of two main building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Adding Moxtra from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Moxtra from the gallery

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Adding Moxtra from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Moxtra from the gallery

trans-unit.source: To configure the integration of Moxtra into Azure AD, you need to add Moxtra from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.
trans-unit.target: To configure the integration of Moxtra into Azure AD, you need to add Moxtra from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.

trans-unit.source: To add Moxtra from the gallery, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add Moxtra from the gallery, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: ![Active Directory][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Active Directory][1]

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][2]

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][3]

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][4]

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type **Moxtra**.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type **Moxtra**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_01.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_01.png)

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Moxtra**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Moxtra**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_02.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_02.png)

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Moxtra based on a test user called "Britta Simon".
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Moxtra based on a test user called "Britta Simon".

trans-unit.source: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in Moxtra to an user in Azure AD is.
trans-unit.target: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in Moxtra to an user in Azure AD is.

trans-unit.source: In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in Moxtra needs to be established.
trans-unit.target: In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in Moxtra needs to be established.

trans-unit.source: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the **user name** in Azure AD as the value of the **Username** in Moxtra.
trans-unit.target: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the **user name** in Azure AD as the value of the **Username** in Moxtra.

trans-unit.source: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Moxtra, you need to complete the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Moxtra, you need to complete the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: **[Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On](#configuring-azure-ad-single-single-sign-on)** - to enable your users to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: **[Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On](#configuring-azure-ad-single-single-sign-on)** - to enable your users to use this feature.

trans-unit.source: **[Creating an Azure AD test user](#creating-an-azure-ad-test-user)** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: **[Creating an Azure AD test user](#creating-an-azure-ad-test-user)** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: **[Creating a Moxtra test user](#creating-a-moxtra-test-user)** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in Moxtra that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.
trans-unit.target: **[Creating a Moxtra test user](#creating-a-moxtra-test-user)** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in Moxtra that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.

trans-unit.source: **[Assigning the Azure AD test user](#assigning-the-azure-ad-test-user)** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: **[Assigning the Azure AD test user](#assigning-the-azure-ad-test-user)** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: **[Testing Single Sign-On](#testing-single-sign-on)** - to verify whether the configuration works.
trans-unit.target: **[Testing Single Sign-On](#testing-single-sign-on)** - to verify whether the configuration works.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your Moxtra application.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your Moxtra application.

trans-unit.source: Your Moxtra application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Moxtra application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Moxtra, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Moxtra, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Moxtra** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign-On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Moxtra** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign-On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On][6]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On][6]

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Moxtra** page, select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Moxtra** page, select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_03.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_03.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App Settings** dialog page, perform the following steps:.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App Settings** dialog page, perform the following steps:.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_04.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_04.png)

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In the **Sign On URL** textbox, type the following URL: **https://www.moxtra.com/service/#login**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Sign On URL** textbox, type the following URL: **https://www.moxtra.com/service/#login**.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_05.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_05.png)

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Click **Download certificate**, and then save the file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download certificate**, and then save the file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: In another browser window, sign on to your Moxtra company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In another browser window, sign on to your Moxtra company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the left, click **Admin Console > SAML Single Sign-on**, and then **New**.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the left, click **Admin Console > SAML Single Sign-on**, and then **New**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_06.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_06.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **SAML** page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **SAML** page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_08.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_08.png)

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** textbox, type a name for your configuration (e.g.: *SAML*).
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** textbox, type a name for your configuration (e.g.: *SAML*).

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog page, copy the **Entity ID** value, and then paste it into the **IdP Entity ID** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog page, copy the **Entity ID** value, and then paste it into the **IdP Entity ID** textbox.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Login URL** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Login URL** textbox.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: In the **AuthnContextClassRef** textbox, tyoe **urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:Password**.
trans-unit.target: In the **AuthnContextClassRef** textbox, tyoe **urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:Password**.

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog page, copy the **Name Identifier Format** value, and then paste it into the **NameID Format** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog page, copy the **Name Identifier Format** value, and then paste it into the **NameID Format** textbox.

trans-unit.source: f.
trans-unit.target: f.

trans-unit.source: Open your downloaded certificate in Notepad, copy the content, and then paste it into the **Certificate** textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your downloaded certificate in Notepad, copy the content, and then paste it into the **Certificate** textbox.

trans-unit.source: g.
trans-unit.target: g.

trans-unit.source: In the SAML email domain textbox, type your SAML email domain.
trans-unit.target: In the SAML email domain textbox, type your SAML email domain.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To see the steps to verify the domain, click the "**i**" below.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To see the steps to verify the domain, click the "**i**" below.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure AD Single Sign-On][10]
trans-unit.target: ![Azure AD Single Sign-On][10]

trans-unit.source: On the **Single sign-on confirmation** page, click **Complete**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Single sign-on confirmation** page, click **Complete**.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure AD Single Sign-On][11]
trans-unit.target: ![Azure AD Single Sign-On][11]

trans-unit.source: To add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration, in the menu on the top, click **Attributes** to open the **SAML Token Attributes** dialog.
trans-unit.target: To add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration, in the menu on the top, click **Attributes** to open the **SAML Token Attributes** dialog.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_general_80.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_general_80.png)

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table below, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table below, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Attribute Name
trans-unit.target: Attribute Name

trans-unit.source: Attribute Value
trans-unit.target: Attribute Value

trans-unit.source: firstname
trans-unit.target: firstname

trans-unit.source: givenname
trans-unit.target: givenname

trans-unit.source: lastname
trans-unit.target: lastname

trans-unit.source: surname
trans-unit.target: surname

trans-unit.source: idpid
trans-unit.target: idpid

trans-unit.source: \<the **Entity ID** value from the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog in the Azure portal \>
trans-unit.target: \<the **Entity ID** value from the **Configure single sign-on at Moxtra** dialog in the Azure portal \>

trans-unit.source: Click **Apply Changes**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Apply Changes**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_general_84.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_general_84.png)

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.

trans-unit.source: ![Create Azure AD User][20]
trans-unit.target: ![Create Azure AD User][20]

trans-unit.source: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/create_aaduser_09.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/create_aaduser_09.png)

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click **Users**.
trans-unit.target: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click **Users**.

trans-unit.target: To open the **Add User** dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click **Add User**.

trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/create_aaduser_04.png)

trans-unit.target: On the **Tell us about this user** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.target: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/create_aaduser_05.png)

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.
trans-unit.target: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the User Name **textbox**, type **BrittaSimon**.
trans-unit.target: In the User Name **textbox**, type **BrittaSimon**.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **User Profile** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **User Profile** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: ![Creating an Azure AD test user](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/create_aaduser_06.png)

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In the **First Name** textbox, type **Britta**.
trans-unit.target: In the **First Name** textbox, type **Britta**.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the **Last Name** textbox, type, **Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Last Name** textbox, type, **Simon**.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: In the **Display Name** textbox, type **Britta Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Display Name** textbox, type **Britta Simon**.

trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: In the **Role** list, select **User**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Role** list, select **User**.

trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.target: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, click **create**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Get temporary password** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Creating a Moxtra test user
trans-unit.target: Creating a Moxtra test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in Moxtra.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in Moxtra.

trans-unit.source: To create a user called Britta Simon in Moxtra, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a user called Britta Simon in Moxtra, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign-on to your Moxtra company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign-on to your Moxtra company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the left, click **Admin Console > User Management**, and then **Add User**.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the left, click **Admin Console > User Management**, and then **Add User**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_10.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_10.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Add User** dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Add User** dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In the **First Name** textbox, type **Britta**.
trans-unit.target: In the **First Name** textbox, type **Britta**.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the **Last Name** textbox, type **Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Last Name** textbox, type **Simon**.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: In the **Email** textbox, type Britta's email address in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: In the **Email** textbox, type Britta's email address in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: In the **Division** textbox, type **Dev**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Division** textbox, type **Dev**.

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: In the **Department** textbox, type **IT**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Department** textbox, type **IT**.

trans-unit.source: f.
trans-unit.target: f.

trans-unit.source: Select **Adminitrator**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Adminitrator**.

trans-unit.source: g.
trans-unit.target: g.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Assigning the Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Assigning the Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enabling Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to Moxtra.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enabling Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to Moxtra.

trans-unit.source: Assign User
trans-unit.target: Assign User

trans-unit.source: To assign Britta Simon to Moxtra, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign Britta Simon to Moxtra, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][201]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][201]

trans-unit.source: In the applications list, select **Moxtra**.
trans-unit.target: In the applications list, select **Moxtra**.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_50.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Configure Single Sign-On](./media/active-directory-saas-moxtra-tutorial/tutorial_moxtra_50.png)

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **Users**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **Users**.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][203]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][203]

trans-unit.source: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.
trans-unit.target: In the Users list, select **Britta Simon**.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the bottom, click **Assign**.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the bottom, click **Assign**.

trans-unit.source: ![Assign User][205]
trans-unit.target: ![Assign User][205]

trans-unit.source: Testing Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Testing Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: When you click the Moxtra tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your Moxtra application.
trans-unit.target: When you click the Moxtra tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your Moxtra application.
